# Experimental Repository

::: accent
Psychologists regularly use experiments to collect data about peoples cognitions, personality, perceptions, or behaviour (amongst other things).

However, there are a number of solutions available for conducting data collection with behavioural tasks, such as the Stroop task, Go/No-Go task, or N-back task. At Wrexham University, we predominantly use 2 solutions; Psychopy and Gorilla.

Each has different strengths and weaknesses, so you should consider which system is best for your research. The video below provides a brief introduction to Gorilla.sc and PsychoPy. We have also listed various experimental tasks.

If you have further questions, you can contact: [psychology.technician\@wrexham.ac.uk](mailto:psychology.technician@wrexham.ac.uk)
:::

An upcoming array of batteries are on their way to be made and gathered as a full list of experimental task (Updated to [Task Builder 2](https://support.gorilla.sc/support/tools/task-builder-2)) within our Wrexham University Repository page on [Gorilla.sc](https://gorilla.sc/). If you are an undergraduate student at Wrexham University you will be expected to create your own version of the task.
